results.title: Return
results.brief_description: Static images of an old country house are combined with voices of the past to evocative effect. Haunting and nostalgic, ‘Return’ conveys the life that exists in old, abandoned places.

results.title: Witness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: Through intermingling static images of a playground, the beach and the town, David Greig paints a picture of Apollo Bay, on the west coast of Victoria, that is evocative and nostalgic.

results.title: Journey of a Nation
results.creator_credit: Catherine Duncan, John Heyer, Australian National Film Board and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This film deals with the need for unification of rail gauges in Australia by showing just what the breaks in gauge at the States’ borders mean to the people who have to ship their goods interstate; particularly primary producers. It also makes a very lively plea for unification, treating its subject humanly, stressing the vital importance of rail transportation in a continent of such vast distances as Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Duncan, John Heyer, Australian National Film Board and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Tullamarine project [original cut]
results.brief_description: A crowd waves goodbye to a T.A.A. flight at Essendon Airport, aerial shots of the City of Melbourne and Yarra River. late developmental stages of construction on the Tullamarine Airport and Freeway. Shot in October 1968.

results.title: Happy birthday
results.brief_description: Touching dedication to a mother by her eldest child, her only son. Scott talks of his close relationship with his mum, of their journey together through dark times, of change and survival and finally a second chance at life, love and family.
results.description: Touching dedication to a mother by her eldest child, her only son. Scott talks of his close relationship with his mum, of their journey together through dark times, of change and survival and finally a second chance at life, love and family.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Kylie
results.brief_description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.
results.description: A story about family relationships and two sisters growing up without a father. Separated by distance, emotionally and physically, Scarlett expresses her thoughts and feelings about her older sister Kylie. Change, it seems, is inevitable but change can also inspire.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: My Nana
results.brief_description: This is a loving tribute to Lorna Joyce Harrington by her grand-daughter, Rebecca. Born into a family of boys in Nunga, Northern Victoria in 1924, Lorna Harrington was separated from her family at the age of 3 weeks old until 7 years old when her mother was too sick to look after her. She worked on the family farm from the age of 13 after her father passed away, eventually escaping to Shepparton to work in the cannery and then finally marrying and settling in Melbourne. To Rebecca, “nana” is the rock in her family - a caring, strong and independent person who has taught her so many things in life.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: The Art of rhyme
results.brief_description:
Ever since a child Mykel has had a fascination for the art of rhyme and a respect for the artistic and creative use of the english language. In this animated piece, he speaks of his dedication to perfecting his art through rap and hip-hop where constant rhyme is no longer a restriction and each syllable and phrase flows into a harmonious melody. “Allowing your mind to be blown away, storming the front of your imagination and pushing it to the limit - that’s the buzz!”
Music by Pabstrakt.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Laughter and hope
results.brief_description: In 1966 at the age of nine Maria Savarino was reunited with her parents who had migrated to Australia from Italy six years earlier. In doing so she also lost a very special person - her Aunt Maria, who had looked after her in those intervening years in Italy. This is Maria’s story about her very special namesake and role model.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Indelible impressions
results.brief_description: A family of women – they share pride and a passion for life; a love for dancing, talking and eating and each woman has left an indelible impression on those of the next generation. In this story Jade shares her memories and thoughts with the newest and youngest member in the family, her niece, and poses the question, “Will the women of our family leave an indelible mark on you just as they did on me?”
